snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration identified a series of failings that allowed millions of small cars to go unfixed for more than a decade.
abstract: Two internal Transportation Dept reports pinpoint failings by National Highway Traffic Safety Administration that permitted millions of General Motors cars with defective ignition switches to go unrepaired for over decade; reports mostly blame GM but bluntly assess mistakes regulators made.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and REBECCA R. RUIZ

lead_paragraph: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration identified a series of failings that allowed millions of small cars to go unfixed for more than a decade.

headline.main: Safety Agency Admits Missing Clues to G.M. Ignition Defects
headline.print_headline: Safety Agency Acknowledges Errors in G.M. Ignition Case
